item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Jack Dawson
item.description: "Well, yes, ma'am, I do... I mean, I got everything I need right here with me. I got air in my lungs, a few blank sheets of paper. I mean, I love waking up in the morning not knowing what's gonna happen or, who I'm gonna meet, where I'm gonna wind up. Just the other night I was sleeping under a bridge and now here I am on the grandest ship in the world having champagne with you fine people. I figure life's a gift and I don't intend on wasting it. You don't know what hand you're gonna get dealt next. You learn to take life as it comes at you... to make each day count." -- Jack Dawson

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Give me neither poverty nor riches but give me only my daily bread. Otherwise, I may have too much and disown you and say, "Who is the Lord?" Or I may become poor and steal and so dishonor the name of my God." -- Anonymous

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Margaret Walker
item.description: "When I was about eight, I decided that the most wonderful thing, next to a human being, was a book." -- Margaret Walker

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "Books say: She did this because. Life says: She did this. Books are where things are explained to you; life is where things aren't. I'm not surprised some people prefer books." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "After nourishment, shelter and companionship, stories are the thing we need most in the world." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Cecelia add a quote by Jules Renard
item.description: "The truly free man is the one who can turn down an invitation to dinner without giving an excuse." -- Jules Renard
